entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 30 at 1:49PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Winds And Blowing Snow Monday Through Wednesday... A series of storm systems moving into the southern Bering Sea will bring strong east winds along with blowing snow and reduced visibility to the West Coast through much of the early to middle part of next week. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 31 at 12:09AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Locally icy travel overnight tonight... With temperatures in the 20s and cold road temperatures, snow showers and isolated freezing drizzle could lead to locally hazardous travel conditions overnight tonight into early Sunday morning. Use caution if traveling, especially on elevated surfaces such as overpasses and bridges.
